arts.ttl: Bayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany still won’t buy into Toni Kroos theory on Jamal Musiala
arts.sum: After Bayern Munich’s 4-2 win over Heidenheim, in which Musiala was subbed into a tied game just after halftime, only to score two goals and help the team pull away, manager Vincent Kompany was still not ready to agree with Kroos. “If you look at the chances we created today, we could’ve scored more goals earlier.

arts.ttl: No rest for the weary: Jamal Musiala saves Bayern Munich’s bacon with super-sub appearance vs. Heidenheim
arts.sum: Bayern Munich ’s 4-2 victory over Heidenheim in the Bundesliga was supposed to be a day of rest for Jamal Musiala. At that point, Bayern Munich should have just played “Enter Sandman” because Musiala came into the match and helped close out a victory with two goals.

arts.ttl: Thomas Müller felt Bayern Munich’s efforts were lacking in 4-2 victory against Heidenheim
arts.sum: We played well [against Leverkusen] on Tuesday, we wanted to be back on track today and play another good game. Bayern Munich completely dominated Heidenheim and scored four goals on top of that to ensure no points for the visiting side.

arts.ttl: Kingsley Coman suffers injury in Bayern Munich’s 4-2 win over Heidenheim, likely out for the rest of the year
arts.sum: Kingsley Coman suffered a muscle injury and it’s very doubtful whether he will play again for Bayern before the winter break. Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany.

arts.ttl: “Total dominance” — Bayern Munich’s Christoph Freund discusses the team’s performance in a 4-2 win against FC Heidenheim
arts.sum: Speaking to Sky after the game, Bayern Munich sporting director Christoph Freund praised the team’s performance while also discussing the conceded goals. We could have scored more goals.

arts.ttl: Five Observations from Bayern Munich’s off script 4-2 win over Heidenheim
arts.sum: Bayern’s 82% possession was the club’s highest output of the season, but Heidenheim battled back to score goals on their only two chances of the match. Bayern’s four goals on 2.36 xG looked efficient on the stat sheet but Bayern completed missed the target in a variety of ways.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s uncomfortably dominant win against Heidenheim
arts.sum: Mathias Honsak worked hard in chasing down the few balls that came his way during the match, requiring an impressive defensive double effort from Dayot Upamecano and Kim Min-jae to stop a run in the first half. Kimmich put in an industrious shift at the heart of Bayern’s midfield, not having been dribbled past a single time, completing 93% of his passes, and having the second most defensive actions of any Bayern player on the pitch at 4 ( FotMob ).

arts.ttl: Bayern updates: Müller experiences minor back problems, Sky reports muscle tear for Coman
arts.sum: Updates on two Bayern players who had to leave the field hurt during Saturday's home victory 1. FC Heidenheim have surfaced.

arts.ttl: European football: Bayern go six clear in Germany as Musiala doubles up
arts.sum: Bundesliga leaders in nervous 4-2 win over Heidenheim Champions Bayer Leverkusen beat St Pauli 2-1 Two second-half goals from substitute Jamal Musiala saw Bayern Munich move six points clear at the top of the Bundesliga after a nervous 4-2 victory over visitors Heidenheim on Saturday. The Bavarians, who take on Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League on Tuesday, were without injured Harry Kane, Manuel Neuer and Serge Gnabry. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Jamal Musiala magic propels Bayern Munich to victory over resilient Heidenheim
arts.sum: Bayern Munich were in control for long periods of their Matchday 13 meeting with Heidenheim, yet the visitors ultimately made life very difficult for the record champions, who needed super-sub Jamal Musiala to net twice as the hosts made it over the line. Michael Olise (l.) celebrates with Bayern's double goalscorer Jamal Musiala.
